Target E-Commerce Revenue Analysis

Dashboard 1: Analyzing Revenue Distribution Across Product Value Bins

Purpose

This dashboard analyzes the distribution of product revenue by value bins, focusing on understanding how different product price ranges contribute to overall revenue and order count. It aims to provide insights into the disproportionate impact of high-value products and uncover the revenue patterns across different product categories. This analysis is critical for identifying high-value categories and prioritizing strategies for revenue optimization.

Key Insights

General Observations

  • High-value products dominate revenue despite low order volume:
    • Products in the $700+ value bin make up only 1.8% of all orders but contribute to 15% of total revenue.
    • Conversely, products in the $7.28–$100 range account for 53.81% of all orders but only 22.49% of total revenue.
  • Top revenue-generating range: The $100–$250 value bin accounts for 39.60% of total revenue, the highest among all bins.

Drillthrough Details

  • Category-specific insights:
    • Health & Beauty is the top-earning category with a total revenue of $1,350,386.50, supported by a high order count of 9,079 orders.
    • Gift Watches, despite having fewer orders (5,643 orders), has a higher average revenue per order, placing its total revenue close to Health & Beauty at $1,238,164.85.

Dashboard Features and Sections

Filters and Selections

Purpose: Enables users to dynamically filter the data by year (2016, 2017, 2018) and by product categories.
Insights: Provides flexibility for analyzing trends over time or focusing on specific product categories.

Screenshots

Category Slicer

Time Slicer

Product Value Distribution Bar Charts

Purpose: This visualization displays the distribution of product values across calculated bin ranges, filtered by selected categories and timeframes.
Features:

  • Includes a combined bar and line chart:
    • The bars represent the percentage of product count.
    • The line represents the percentage of revenue.
    • A gradient overlay on the bars indicates revenue contributions, with darker greens signifying higher contributions.
Insights:
  • Identifies which bin ranges contribute the most to revenue and product count percentages.
  • Enables comparison between revenue and product count distributions within the same bin ranges.
  • For example:
    • The $700+ bin range accounts for only 1.8% of total products (shown by the bar) while contributing 15.06% of total revenue (shown by the line).
Important Note: A dedicated breakaway stacked bar chart highlights the specific impact of the $700+ bin range for further insights.

Screenshots

Product Value Distribution Bar and Line Chart

700+ Bin Range Impact

Revenue Highlights

Purpose: This section provides insights into:

  • The top-selling product ID across the selected dataset (by time and category filters or by selected product value range).
  • The percentage metrics for revenue and product count based on the applied filters.
Functionality:
  1. Top Product-ID
    • Displays the product_id of the top-selling product within the currently selected filters (e.g., category or year).
    • Changes dynamically when filters are applied, allowing users to focus on specific time frames or product categories.
  2. Percentage Metrics:
    • Revenue %:The percentage contribution of the currently selected dataset to the total revenue.
    • Product %: The percentage of products within the current selection relative to the entire dataset.
    • Both metrics reflect the impact of the applied filters, providing a snapshot of the selected scope.
Key Insights:
  • Dynamic Adaptability:
    • In its unfiltered state, the KPI cards provide overall metrics for the dataset.
    • Filters enable granular analysis, highlighting top performers and their relative contributions to the selected scope.
  • Example Scenarios:
    • Selecting 2018 and the category "Health & Beauty" may display a different product_id and corresponding revenue/product percentages than the unfiltered view.

Screenshots

Top Product ID

Revenue Percentage KPI Card

Product Count Percentage KPI Card

Product Value Table

Purpose: This table provides a detailed breakdown of product performance across different value ranges, allowing users to analyze key metrics for each range.
Features:

  • Displays metrics for each value bin range, including:
    • Product Count
    • Product %
    • Product % by Category
    • Total Revenue
    • Revenue %
    • Revenue % by Category
    • Weighted Average Revenue
    • Median Revenue
  • Users can right-click on a specific value bin range to drill through to a dedicated dashboard. This drill-through dashboard filters information based on the selected bin range.
  • Filters applied by the drill-through can be removed to view metrics across all value bin ranges if desired.
Insights:
  • Highlights the distribution of products and revenue across value ranges.
  • Enables comparisons between revenue contributions and product counts for each bin range.
  • Supports granular analysis of performance within specific value ranges or product categories.

Screenshots

Drillthrough Dashboard

Full Dashboard

Purpose: This drillthrough table provides a detailed breakdown of:

  • Revenue contributions across selected value bins.
  • The distribution of revenue percentages for each product category.
  • Product-level details, including total revenue and average revenue.
Features:

The dashboard includes three visualizations and one slicer:

  1. Selected Metric Slicer
    • This slicer allows users to choose the metric to display. The subsequent heatmap visualization updates dynamically based on the selected metric.
    • To learn more about the Selected Metric measure, click here.
  2. Product Category Value Distribution Heatmap
    • The heatmap provides granular insights into the performance of all product categories within the value bin ranges. It dynamically updates based on the bin range filtered in the main dashboard.
    • The displayed values change depending on the metric selected in the slicer.
    • The visualization title dynamically updates to reflect the selected metric and product category filters. Learn more about the dynamic title measure here.
  3. Product ID Details Table
    • This table displays revenue information for various product_ids, ordered by top revenue.
    • Additional details include the associated Product Category.
    • The table dynamically filters based on the selected value bin range and product category from the main dashboard.
  4. Product Category Details Table
    • This table provides a high-level breakdown of product category performance, complementing the Product ID Details Table.
    • Values in this table dynamically filter based on the selected product value range.

Screenshots

Selected Metric

Product Category Value Distribution Heatmap

Product ID Details Table

Product Category Details Table

Insights in Action

  • Revenue Maximization: Focus on high-value categories like Personal Computers and Gift Watches, which contribute disproportionately to revenue.
  • Product Strategy: Leverage pricing strategies in mid-range bins ($100–$250) that drive the largest share of revenue.
  • Inventory Management: Prioritize stocking and promoting products in categories with high average revenue, even with lower order counts.

Measures Used

This section provides an overview of the key measures used in this dashboard. For a look at all measures used across my analysis, refer to the DAX Measures Document. Otherwise, use the links below to navigate to the respective measure.

  • Product Count: The total number of products within a specific value bin range. Learn more.
  • Product %: The percentage of total products in the dataset that fall within the bin range. Learn more.
  • Product % by Category: The percentage of products in a specific value bin range within a selected product category. Learn more.
  • Total Revenue: The total revenue generated by products in the bin range. Learn more.
  • Revenue %: The percentage of total revenue generated by products in the bin range. Learn more.
  • Revenue % by Category: The percentage of revenue generated by products in the bin range within a specific category. Learn more.
  • Weighted Average Revenue: The average revenue weighted by product count in the bin range. Learn more.
  • Median Revenue: The median revenue value for products in the bin range. Learn more.
